<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
POLITICS
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/10/17/white-house-fire-plans-host-g7-summit-trump-resort?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Trump to World Leaders: Wanna Come Back to My Place?
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Trump to World Leaders: Wanna Come Back to My Place?" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiIxNTcxMzQ0MzI2LmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im1vcm5pbmdicmV3LW9zbG8iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Francis Scialabba</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">White House Acting Chief of Staff Mick Mulvaney <a href="https://apnews.com/3c58409d63094e32b44794981a3a407c?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">announced</a> yesterday the location for next year's G7 summit: the Trump Doral golf resort near Miami.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">By all accounts, it's a lovely venue to host world leaders—cozy bungalows for trade negotiations, high-ceilings for when industrial policy debates get steamy, plenty of parking... </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">There's just one problem</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">President Trump owns Doral. Ethics watchdogs see a glaring conflict of interest in the U.S. president hosting a delegation of world leaders at his own property.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Citizens for Responsibility and Ethics in Washington </span><span><a href="https://www.citizensforethics.org/press-release/trump-g7-doral/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">said in a statement</a></span><span>: "Given the potential consequences the president is facing for abusing the presidency for his own gain, we would have thought he would steer clear of blatant corruption…" </span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>"Instead he has doubled down on it." </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Democrats agree.</strong> They've argued for years that President Trump has repeatedly violated the Constitution's "emoluments" clause, which bars the president from making money off foreign governments. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>So far, legal challenges have </span><span><a href="https://thehill.com/regulation/court-battles/452388-appeals-court-dismisses-emoluments-clause-lawsuit-in-win-for-trump?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">gotten nowhere</a></span><span>. </span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>President Trump has not divested from his businesses since entering office, but he has placed his holdings into a trust.</span></li>
</ul>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">The White House's defense</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Mulvaney said he sent scouts out to nearly a dozen different locations and they came to one conclusion: "It's not the only place," he said, "it's the best place." Mulvaney explained that Doral was millions of dollars cheaper than the next location and that Trump "will <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2019-10-17/trump-to-host-g7-at-his-miami-resort-fueling-conflict-claims?srnd=premium&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">not be profiting</a> here." </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The backstory: </strong>President Trump first floated Doral as a potential host venue at the G7's most recent summit in Biarritz, France. "It's got tremendous acreage, many hundreds of acres, so we can handle whatever happens," he <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2019/08/26/world/europe/trump-doral-g7.html?module=inline&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">said</a> in August. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">And with tremendous acreage comes tremendous sales. </strong></span><span>Doral generates the most revenue among all of Trump's hotels or golf clubs, </span><span><a href="https://www.washingtonpost.com/politics/trump-has-awarded-next-years-g-7-summit-of-world-leaders-to-his-miami-area-resort-the-white-house-said/2019/10/17/221b32d6-ef52-11e9-89eb-ec56cd414732_story.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">per the WaPo</a></span><span>. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out: </strong>The White House's decision comes during a highly contentious time in D.C. Democrats are currently pursuing an impeachment inquiry that's investigating whether President Trump is illegally profiting off his position. </p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>

<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
SOCIAL MEDIA
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/10/17/mark-zuckerberg-gives-big-speech-free-speech?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Zuck Tries James Madison Cosplay
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Zuck Tries James Madison Cosplay" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiIxNTcxMzQ5NzU4LmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im1vcm5pbmdicmV3LW9zbG8iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Riccardo Savi/Getty Images for Facebook</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Yesterday, Facebook CEO Mark Zuckerberg <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2019/10/17/business/zuckerberg-facebook-free-speech.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">gave a speech</a> in defense of free expression at Georgetown University in D.C.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The backstory:</strong> Zuckerberg's college side project is <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/10/13/sen-elizabeth-warren-runs-knowingly-false-ads-check-facebook?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">under fire</a> for its political advertising policies (which allow politicians to post false information) as well as ongoing issues with hate speech and disinformation. In response to that criticism, Zuck's positioning himself and Facebook as champions of the First Amendment. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Some of <a href="https://newsroom.fb.com/news/2019/10/mark-zuckerberg-stands-for-voice-and-free-expression/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">his points</a>…</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>He understands concerns about Big Tech's centralized power, but believes social media has also </span><span><em>decentralized</em></span><span> power by allowing people to communicate freely. </span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>He railed against the idea that speech can cause division. Thomas Zuckerson believes </span><span><em>limiting</em></span><span> speech causes conflict. </span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>He pointed out that recent movements like #MeToo and #BlackLivesMatter either began or built momentum on social media. </span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Referring to the civil rights movement and abolition of slavery, he argued that restricting expression in times of social tension hurts minority viewpoints. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line: </strong>Zuck wants you to associate Facebook with freedom and democracy, and his critics with censorship.</p>

<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
INTERNATIONAL
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/10/17/british-mps-will-vote-brexit?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
How to Get Away With Brexit
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<!--[if mso]>
<img alt="How to Get Away With Brexit" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" height=447 src="https://morningbrew-oslo.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/1571344670.gif">
<![endif]-->
<!--[if !mso]>--><!-- -->
<img class="story-header-image" alt="How to Get Away With Brexit" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" src="https://morningbrew-oslo.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/1571344670.gif">
<!--<![endif]-->
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Francis Scialabba</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Tomorrow, British MPs vote on Prime Minister Boris Johnson's <a href="https://www.bbc.com/news/uk-politics-50079385?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Brexit deal</a>, which EU officials approved yesterday after three years of pulling crooked teeth. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">In the deal: </strong>95% of stuff that was in former PM Theresa May's, including measures around cross-border data flows, citizens' rights, and a $42.5 billion divorce bill that even has the Bezoses wincing.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">What's different: </strong>The Irish backstop is adjusted to align Northern Ireland with EU customs (for more detail, read <a href="https://www.vox.com/world/2019/10/17/20918879/brexit-deal-boris-johnson-european-union-irish-backstop?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">this</a>). Also, Johnson doesn't want to be beholden to EU regulations. </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Math time</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Johnson needs 320 yeas. Assuming no defectors in his own party, by most counts he's just shy of 290. His <a href="https://edition.cnn.com/uk/live-news/brexit-eu-summit-oct-17-dle-intl-gbr/h_723e90c14e31269c0e1d1517f40029d5?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">options include</a>: </p>
<ol>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Former conservative MPs (some of whom he expelled over </span><span><a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/09/05/recapping-wild-week-brexit-negotiations?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">internal party drama</a></span><span>)</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Northern Ireland's 10 Democratic Unionists (who oppose the deal's trade terms)</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Members of the opposition Labour party (whose leader said this deal is worse than the previous one, though a handful are likely to vote for it)</span></li>
</ol>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line:</strong> It'll be a close vote, probably down to single-digit margins.</p>

<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
E-CIG
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/10/17/juul-removes-sweet-flavors-stores-curb-underage-use?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Juul's Shrinking Act 2: Back in the Habit
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Juul's Shrinking Act 2: Back in the Habit" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiIxNTcxMzQ1OTMyLmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im1vcm5pbmdicmV3LW9zbG8iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Juul</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Juul continued its dramatic retreat yesterday, saying it'll <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2019/10/17/e-cigarette-giant-juul-suspends-sales-of-fruity-flavors-ahead-of-looming-ban.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">stop</a> online sales of some flavored e-cigarettes in the U.S. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">What's no longer available: </strong></span><span>sweet and dessert-y flavors including mango, fruit, and cucumber. Those were not available in physical stores, but had been online.</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">What's still available: </strong></span><span>Mint, menthol, and tobacco flavors in stores and online. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Juul's revenue in the first half of 2019 came out to $1.3 billion, <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/juul-halts-online-sales-of-some-flavored-e-cigarettes-11571331640?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">according to the WSJ</a>. Less than 10% of those sales came from online purchases. </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">How the smoky have fallen</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">If you think back to last December, Juul was valued at $38 billion; teens walked around with their phone in one hand, a vape in the other. But 2019 has been a different story. Growing awareness of the youth vaping epidemic has led to an aggressive regulatory crackdown, and the FDA is set to pull most e-cigs from the market.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Looking ahead...</strong>new Juul CEO K.C. Crosthwaite is <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2019-10-17/juul-pods-will-no-longer-be-available-in-u-s-in-most-flavors?srnd=premium&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">working on</a> a "reset" to "combat underage use while providing an alternative to adult smokers." </p>

<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
QUIZ
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/10/17/brews-weekly-news-quiz-october-18?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">

O, Canaquiz

</h1>

<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Already legal in 50 states. Bandwagon Nats fan. Has fewer Instagram followers than Jennifer Aniston (but not for long...<a href="https://www.instagram.com/morningbrew/?hl=en&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">follow us here</a>). It’s the Brew’s Weekly News Quiz.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">1. <strong style="color:#000">Fill in the blanks: </strong>In June 2018, Deloitte <a href="https://finance-commerce.com/2019/10/one-year-in-legal-canadian-pot-is-a-disappointment/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">predicted</a> legal sales of cannabis would climb to C$__ in 2019. In the first seven months of the year, Canadians bought C$__ of legal weed.</p>
<ol type="a">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>4.3 billion, 524 million</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>524 million, 4.3 billion</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>2.1 billion, 362 million</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>362 million, 2.1 billion</span></li>
</ol>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">2. DiGiornio is delivering pizza, and this multiplex chain is betting on at-home streaming so you’ll never have to leave home again. <strong style="color:#000">Can you name it?</strong></p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">3. Which of the following apparel collabs <em>isn’t </em>real?</p>
<ol type="a">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Crocs x Post Malone</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Taco Bell x Forever 21</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Virgin Galactic x Under Armour</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>McDonald’s x Supreme</span></li>
</ol>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">4. Three very smart humans won the Nobel Prize in economics this week. <strong style="color:#000">What are their names?</strong> One point for each and a Nobel Prize in Quizzes for all three.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">5. What is Xerox’s Color of the Year?</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><sup class="sub-text"><em><strong style="color:#000">Answers:</strong> 1. C$4.3 billion, C$524 million 2. AMC 3. McDonald’s x Supreme 4. Abhijit Banerjee, Esther Duflo, and Michael Kremer 5. Clear</em></sup></p>

collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eWhite House Acting Chief of Staff Mick Mulvaney \u003ca href=\"https://apnews.com/3c58409d63094e32b44794981a3a407c?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eannounced\u003c/a\u003e yesterday the location for next year's G7 summit: the Trump Doral golf resort near Miami.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eBy all accounts, it's a lovely venue to host world leaders—cozy bungalows for trade negotiations, high-ceilings for when industrial policy debates get steamy, plenty of parking... \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eThere's just one problem\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003ePresident Trump owns Doral. Ethics watchdogs see a glaring conflict of interest in the U.S. president hosting a delegation of world leaders at his own property.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eCitizens for Responsibility and Ethics in Washington \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.citizensforethics.org/press-release/trump-g7-doral/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003esaid in a statement\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e: \"Given the potential consequences the president is facing for abusing the presidency for his own gain, we would have thought he would steer clear of blatant corruption…\" \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\"Instead he has doubled down on it.\" \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eDemocrats agree.\u003c/strong\u003e They've argued for years that President Trump has repeatedly violated the Constitution's \"emoluments\" clause, which bars the president from making money off foreign governments. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eSo far, legal challenges have \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://thehill.com/regulation/court-battles/452388-appeals-court-dismisses-emoluments-clause-lawsuit-in-win-for-trump?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003egotten nowhere\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003ePresident Trump has not divested from his businesses since entering office, but he has placed his holdings into a trust.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eThe White House's defense\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eMulvaney said he sent scouts out to nearly a dozen different locations and they came to one conclusion: \"It's not the only place,\" he said, \"it's the best place.\" Mulvaney explained that Doral was millions of dollars cheaper than the next location and that Trump \"will \u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2019-10-17/trump-to-host-g7-at-his-miami-resort-fueling-conflict-claims?srnd=premium\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003enot be profiting\u003c/a\u003e here.\" \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe backstory: \u003c/strong\u003ePresident Trump first floated Doral as a potential host venue at the G7's most recent summit in Biarritz, France. \"It's got tremendous acreage, many hundreds of acres, so we can handle whatever happens,\" he \u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2019/08/26/world/europe/trump-doral-g7.html?module=inline\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003esaid\u003c/a\u003e in August. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eAnd with tremendous acreage comes tremendous sales. \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003eDoral generates the most revenue among all of Trump's hotels or golf clubs, \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.washingtonpost.com/politics/trump-has-awarded-next-years-g-7-summit-of-world-leaders-to-his-miami-area-resort-the-white-house-said/2019/10/17/221b32d6-ef52-11e9-89eb-ec56cd414732_story.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eper the WaPo\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eZoom out: \u003c/strong\u003eThe White House's decision comes during a highly contentious time in D.C. Democrats are currently pursuing an impeachment inquiry that's investigating whether President Trump is illegally profiting off his position. \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eYesterday, Facebook CEO Mark Zuckerberg \u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2019/10/17/business/zuckerberg-facebook-free-speech.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe backstory:\u003c/strong\u003e Zuckerberg's college side project is \u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/10/13/sen-elizabeth-warren-runs-knowingly-false-ads-check-facebook?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" In response to that criticism, Zuck's positioning himself and Facebook as champions of the First Amendment. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eSome of \u003ca href=\"https://newsroom.fb.com/news/2019/10/mark-zuckerberg-stands-for-voice-and-free-expression/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ehis points\u003c/a\u003e…\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eHe understands concerns about Big Tech's centralized power, but believes social media has also \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cem\u003edecentralized\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e power by allowing people to communicate freely. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eHe railed against the idea that speech can cause division. Thomas Zuckerson believes \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cem\u003elimiting\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e speech causes conflict. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eHe pointed out that recent movements like #MeToo and #BlackLivesMatter either began or built momentum on social media. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eReferring to the civil rights movement and abolition of slavery, he argued that restricting expression in times of social tension hurts minority viewpoints. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBottom line: \u003c/strong\u003eZuck wants you to associate Facebook with freedom and democracy, #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eBrexit deal\u003c/a\u003e, which EU officials approved yesterday after three years of pulling crooked teeth. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eIn the deal: \u003c/strong\u003e95% of stuff that was in former PM Theresa May's, including measures around cross-border data flows, citizens' rights, and a $42.5 billion divorce bill that even has the Bezoses wincing.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eWhat's different: \u003c/strong\u003eThe Irish backstop is adjusted to align Northern Ireland with EU customs (for more detail, read \u003ca href=\"https://www.vox.com/world/2019/10/17/20918879/brexit-deal-boris-johnson-european-union-irish-backstop?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ethis\u003c/a\u003e). Also, Johnson doesn't want to be beholden to EU regulations. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eMath time\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eJohnson needs 320 yeas. Assuming no defectors in his own party, by most counts he's just shy of 290. His \u003ca href=\"https://edition.cnn.com/uk/live-news/brexit-eu-summit-oct-17-dle-intl-gbr/h_723e90c14e31269c0e1d1517f40029d5?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eoptions include\u003c/a\u003e: \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003col\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eFormer conservative MPs (some of whom he expelled over \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/09/05/recapping-wild-week-brexit-negotiations?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003einternal party drama\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e)\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eNorthern Ireland's 10 Democratic Unionists (who oppose the deal's trade terms)\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eMembers of the opposition Labour party (whose leader said this deal is worse than the previous one, though a handful are likely to href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2019/10/17/e-cigarette-giant-juul-suspends-sales-of-fruity-flavors-ahead-of-looming-ban.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eWhat's no longer available: \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003esweet and dessert-y flavors including mango, fruit, and cucumber. Those were not available in physical stores, but had been online.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eWhat's still available: \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003eMint, menthol, and tobacco flavors in stores and online. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eJuul's revenue in the first half of 2019 came out to $1.3 billion, \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/juul-halts-online-sales-of-some-flavored-e-cigarettes-11571331640?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eaccording to the WSJ\u003c/a\u003e. Less than 10% of those sales came from online purchases. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eHow the smoky have fallen\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eIf you think back to last December, Juul was valued at $38 billion; teens walked around with their phone in one hand, a vape in the other. But 2019 has been a different story.
